verses.verse: A good name <WH8034> is more desirable <WH977> than great <WH7227> riches, <WH6239> and loving <WH2896> favor <WH2580> is better than silver <WH3701> and gold. <WH2091>

The result <WH6118> of humility <WH6038> and the fear <WH3374> of Yahweh <WH3068> is wealth, <WH6239> honor, <WH3519> and life. <WH2416>

He who loves <WH157> purity <WH2890> of heart <WH3820> and speaks <WH8193> gracefully <WH2580> is the king <WH4428>'s friend. <WH7453>

The sluggard <WH6102> says, <WH559> "There is a lion <WH738> outside! <WH2351> I will be killed <WH7523> in <WH8432> the streets! <WH7339>"

Whoever oppresses <WH6231> the poor <WH1800> for his own increase <WH7235> and whoever gives <WH5414> to the rich, <WH6223> both come to poverty. <WH4270>
Turn <WH5186> your ear, <WH241> and listen <WH241> to the words <WH1697> of the wise. <WH2450> Apply <WH7896> your heart <WH3820> to my teaching. <WH1847>
For it is a pleasant thing <WH5273> if you keep <WH8104> them within <WH990> you, <WH3162> if all of them are ready <WH3559> on your lips. <WH8193>

Haven't <WH3789> I written to you <WH8032> thirty excellent things <WH7991> of counsel <WH4156> and knowledge, <WH1847>
To teach <WH3045> you truth, <WH571> reliable <WH7189> words, <WH561> to give <WH561> sound <WH571> answers <WH7725> to the ones who sent you? <WH7971>
Don't <WH1497> exploit the poor, <WH1800> because he is poor; <WH1800> and don't <WH1792> crush the needy <WH6041> in court; <WH8179>
for Yahweh <WH3068> will plead <WH7378> their case, <WH7379> and plunder <WH6906> the life <WH5315> of those who plunder them. <WH6906>
Don't <WH7462> befriend a hot-tempered <WH639> man, <WH1167> and don't <WH935> associate with one <WH1167> who harbors anger: <WH2534>
lest you learn <WH502> his ways, <WH734> and <WH3947> ensnare <WH4170> your soul. <WH5315>
Don't <WH8628> you be one of those who strike hands, <WH3709> of those who are collateral <WH6148> for debts. <WH4859>
If you don't <WH7999> have means to pay, why should he take away <WH3947> your bed from under you? <WH4904>

Do you see <WH2372> a man <WH376> skilled <WH4106> in his work? <WH4399> He will serve <WH3320> <WH6440> kings. <WH4428> He won't <WH3320> serve <WH6440> obscure men. <WH2823>
